Prayer Whenever we pray for you, we give thanks to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, because we have received news of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love you have for all the saints because of the hope reserved for you in heaven. You have already learned of this hope through the word of truth, which is the gospel that has come to you. This gospel is bearing fruit and growing all over the world, just as it has been among you since the day you learned of God\'s grace and fully understood it. Colossians 1:3-6
Lord our God, we praise your name, because we can bear witness to what we see and hear, of all the good that you have given us. May we be firmly and faithfully united, awaiting the glorious day when your almighty hand prevails in victory and puts an end to so many evils among us. On that day you will be praised throughout all nations and everything will be clothed in newness, to the glory of your great name. Amen. Always be joyful, pray without ceasing, give thanks to God in every situation, because this is his will for you in Christ Jesus. 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18
Father in heaven, we thank you because we can feel your guidance, your lordship, because in Christ you have blessed us with every spiritual and heavenly gift. We thank you that we can be among those who always receive true new life, among those who praise and glorify you; joyous even on difficult days. Because it is precisely on difficult days that we need to be one of those who are joyful and grateful, who always find a new certainty in their lives. With them we can experience the good that you give on earth, so that humanity may be blessed and finally come into your hands. Amen. That true light, the one that illuminates every human being, came to this world. He who was the light was already in the world, and the world was created through him, but the world did not recognize him. He came to what was his, but his own did not receive him. But to all who received him, to those who believe in his name, he gave the right to be children of God. John 1:9-12
Dear Father in heaven, we thank you that we can be your children. We thank you for giving us your Spirit, to truly be your children. Gather us in communion with you, so that our mind and heart, and everything within us, realize the joy that we can receive through your gifts. Although today\'s world is in confusion, doubt and lost in material things, give us the inner serenity to receive from you the power of faith. Because through faith we can learn to know what you are and what you will one day be for all mankind, through Jesus Christ the Lord. Amen. That is why I, who am in prison for the cause of the Lord, beg you to live in a manner worthy of the calling you have received, always humble and kind, patient, tolerant with one another in love. Strive to maintain the unity of the Spirit through the bond of peace. Ephesians 4:1-3
Dear Father in heaven, we thank you for the blessings you give us on earth, since it is through your gifts and work, and through the work of your children, that we can believe and be saved. Protect us here in our home. May we lovingly be tolerant with one another, and spare no effort to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace. Grant us new strength and new gifts wherever we need them on the path you have prepared for us. Grant us to rejoice and trust in you until we reach the goal. Amen. "Lord," replied Simon Peter, "to whom shall we go?" You have words of eternal life. And we have believed, and we know that you are the Holy One of God. John 6:68-69
Dear Father in heaven, we come to you seeking communion with you, because we know that all life comes from you, all progress between us depends on you, and our inner being can be strengthened by your Spirit. Protect us and renew our strength again and again, so that your will be done among us and we can all find courage for our lives, even when many difficulties threaten us. Grant us to remain as your servants and walk with joy to await what is to come. Bless us today and every day according to your promises. Amen. I have dispelled your transgressions like the dew, and your sins like the morning mist. Come back to me, I have redeemed you. Isaiah 44:22
Lord our God, we thank you for establishing us on the firm foundation of your Word and your promise, a promise that expresses the great longing and hope that is in the hearts of so many people. Because they do not want their lives to remain in disgrace and superficiality, but rather they aspire to something higher, with the joy that the promise can be fulfilled in them. So we too today want to be prepared for the coming time that you will bring, and we rejoice in our hope for the future. We rejoice in the anticipation of the time, when you will give your Spirit to us and to all who respond to your call and become your collaborators. Amen. While you have the light, believe in it, so that you are children of the light. John 12:36a
Beloved Father in heaven, as your children we come before your presence, so that you guide us with the light that radiates from you. We come to your light, seeking an inner birth to make us what your children should be. Bless us by giving you thanks for all the kindness and powerful help you have given to many of us. Accept the graces we offer you, and help us to never forget the good you do for us. Help us to go forward, always forward, until the consummation of your kingdom. May it not be in vain that we live for the Lord Jesus and with love for you, the God and Father of all. May it not be in vain to bring our prayers and petitions, so that your kingdom may soon come. Yes, come Lord Jesus! Come soon to this earth, so that all people can recognize the true God and love you. Amen. Do nothing out of selfishness or vanity; rather, humbly regard others as superior to yourselves. Each one must look out not only for their own interests but also for the interests of others. Your attitude should be like that of Christ Jesus. Philippians 2:3-5
Lord our God, we come before you in the great name of Jesus Christ. We thank you that while we still live on earth, you give us hope and joy in this great name. May something be born within us through your Spirit, and let us become of one mind with Jesus Christ. In all our dealings with others, may we learn that it is better for him to patiently submit than to dominate; better to serve than to rule, better to be the weakest than to oppress others. Give us this attitude, so that it manifests itself in many and they become Christians, not only in their words and thoughts, but Christians in heart, loving their neighbors in unity with the Savior, every step of the way. Amen. Because where two or three gather in my name, there am I in their midst. Matthew 18:20
Lord our God and Father, we praise you that you allow us to have community together in the name of Jesus, who has opened our eyes to see you, and who has promised to be among us when we gather in his name. May our hearts remain free from shadows, even when our lives become difficult and the future seems bleak. Protect us whenever we find ourselves in temptation and have battles to fight. Free us; make us free people, who understand that they belong to you, and that, while we are still on earth, allow us to participate in eternal life. Amen. Who will separate us from the love of Christ? Tribulation, or anguish, persecution, famine, want, danger, or violence?... Yet in all these we are more than conquerors through him who loved us. Romans 8:35, 37
Lord our God, what can separate us from your love? Can they perhaps difficulties, fear, persecution, hunger, nakedness, danger or the sword? In all these things we are more than conquerors, through him who loved us. Dear Father in heaven, we want to be brave. You will answer our prayers and give us, again and again, the strength, the power of your Spirit, the only power that can strengthen us. We thank you for everything you have done for us. Help us to advance from victory to victory, until everything on earth is overcome for good, to your honor in all humanity. Amen. How beautiful are, on the mountains, the feet of the one who brings good news; the one who proclaims peace, the one who announces good news, the one who proclaims salvation, the one who says to Zion: "Your God reigns"! Listen! Your sentinels raise their voices, and together they shout for joy, because they see with their own eyes that the Lord returns to Zion. Isaiah 52:7-8
Lord our God, grant us to be your sentinels, who understand what you mean for our time. We thank you for all that you have already done and for every change for good among the nations. Because the nations must yield to your will, since nothing happens unless it is achieved by you. Judge us when necessary. Open our eyes to see where we are wrong and not according to your Spirit. Be with us and give us strength. Wherever something happens to touch human hearts, let the sentinels proclaim: “This is from God. It doesn\'t matter how much we suffer; this comes from Jesus Christ, who suffered and died, but rose again.” Raise such sentinels among young and old throughout the world. Let there be a people that come out to meet you, shouting with joy and gratitude. Amen. The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him; I get help from him. My heart leaps for joy, and with songs I will give thanks. Psalm 28:7
Lord our God, you are our strength and shield. Our hearts wait on you, and we receive help. Accept us from among all nations as a people who want to serve you. Strengthen our hearts, especially when we must be tested in many ways and must face many difficulties that come when we accept our mission to proclaim your name and bear witness to you. Because you are strong and you can protect us. You can fill us with light and joy, to proclaim again and again the salvation that comes through your almighty goodness and mercy; salvation in Jesus Christ the Lord. Amen. The ransomed of the Lord will return, and will enter Zion with songs of joy; his crown will be eternal joy. They will be filled with joy and gladness, and sorrow and groaning will depart from them. "It is I myself who consoles them." Isaiah 51:11-12a
Lord our God, we thank you for the trust you have placed in our hearts. We thank you for all the signs of your goodness, which comfort us when we are in great need, and when so many deaths occur around us that impact each of us. We thank you for comforting us and for always giving us fresh encouragement wherever we are, and for giving us hope for other people, who also struggle hard to find what is good. O Lord God, bless our world with power from on high, with gifts that bring good to many people. Bless our world; save him from sin, from ruin and from all kinds of despair. Bless us, O Lord our God! Just as you bless us, bless the whole world, to the glory of your name. Amen. If you had paid attention to my commandments, your peace would have been like a river; your justice, like the waves of the sea. Isaiah 48:18
Lord our God, help us to heed your commandments, so that our peace may be like a river and our justice like the waves of the sea. We ask that you remain with us through your Spirit. Talk to us and tell us what we need to hear, to understand everything that always brings us closer to you. Show us the power of your hand to help us and all people. We are not going to despair, even on trial; we are not going to lose courage because of problems and afflictions. Come with your strength, so that we can be strong and overcome the world through Jesus Christ the Savior. Amen. Whenever we pray for you, we give thanks to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, because we have received news of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love you have for all the saints because of the hope reserved for you in heaven. You have already learned of this hope through the word of truth, which is the gospel that has come to you. This gospel is bearing fruit and growing all over the world, just as it has been among you since the day you learned of God\'s grace and fully understood it. Colossians 1:3-6
Lord our God, we praise your name, because we can bear witness to what we see and hear, of all the good that you have given us. May we be firmly and faithfully united, awaiting the glorious day when your almighty hand prevails in victory and puts an end to so many evils among us. On that day you will be praised throughout all nations and everything will be clothed in newness, to the glory of your great name. Amen. Trust in God, and he will help you; proceed righteously and wait on him. You who honor the Lord, trust in his mercy; do not deviate from the straight path, so as not to fall. Those who honor the Lord trust in him, and they will not go unrewarded. Sirach 2:6-8 DHH
Dear Father in heaven, we come before you to receive what we need as your children, for we cannot find help and guidance on our own, but only through your Spirit. Enlighten us with your Word, which only you can give. You will give us your Word to know, with absolute certainty and clarity, how to serve you. Your Word will show us the truth that will be revealed in Jesus Christ to the world. Keep us in the shelter of your hands. Strengthen us, especially during suffering, and free us from fear and trembling. Fill our hearts with patience and joy. Amen. //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// Peace I leave you; I give you my peace. I do not give it to you as the world does. Do not be distressed or cowered. John 14:27
Dear Father in heaven, we thank you for keeping a path open in our hearts and for bringing us the peace of Jesus Christ. Help us keep this path open. Grant us peace in this world devastated by storms. Grant us peace when many difficulties and uncertainties try to occupy our hearts. We do not have strength in ourselves, only in him, who lives and gives us strength, who is by our side and will never abandon us. His light will always break again between us. His light will shine on many people and will lead them to the promised day; the day that will fulfill all our hopes. Amen. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// But I am always with you, because you hold me by the right hand. You guide me with your advice, and later you will welcome me in glory. Psalm 73:23-24
Thank you, great God and Father, for filling our hearts with trust that gives us good hope, also for those who have not yet found this trust. Thank you for giving us the courage to face all the issues that arise in human life, and for accepting us again and again when we come before you. You know what is ahead of us, you know the mountains that must be moved; you know all the things that frustrate us and try to wear us down; and you will remove them. In the end, your light will shine in all the darkness; and this certainty fills us with joy and gratitude. In this faith we are determined to stand firm and persevere until victory. Amen. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// Who do I have in heaven but you? If I\'m with you, I don\'t want anything on earth anymore. My body and my spirit may fail, but God strengthens my heart; he is my eternal inheritance. Psalm 73:25-26
Beloved God and our Father, if we only have you, we do not want anything else in heaven or on earth. Body and soul may fail but you, O God, are the strength and comfort of our hearts, and you are ours forever. May we live in your Spirit and may your light shine on us. Touch our hearts and help us understand the greatness of your calling us. Help us and deliver us again and again so that we are not bound by fear, even when we must go through intense suffering. Because your hand will be with us and rescue us. Your hand will achieve good for us and for all the people around us. Our hearts go out to them and we also pray for them: "Lord, send your Savior to all." Amen. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// Therefore, there is no longer any condemnation for those who are united to Christ Jesus. Romans 8:1\n\n
Lord our God, grant us to be your children, who receive from you the Spirit and everything we need. You strengthen us, not only physically, but also within us, in our hearts, enabling us to face the uncertainties of earthly life and all that still needs to be changed in human society. Keep us from giving in to our weaknesses. May your power always be with us. May we have patience and hope, because you are working for good and we can look forward to it. Amen. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// Finally, brothers, consider well everything that is true, everything that is respectable, everything that is just, everything that is pure, everything that is lovely, everything that is worthy of admiration, in short, everything that is excellent or deserves praise. Put into practice what you have learned, received and heard from me, and what you have seen in me, and the God of peace will be with you. Philippians 4:8-9
Dear Father in heaven, let our thoughts be filled with all that is honorable, just, pure, kind, good, and praiseworthy. We want to wait for your Spirit, without giving rise to anxiety, but showing ourselves worthy of being your children. We want to be your children, who rise above even the most difficult conditions and maintain a quiet trust, to the glory of your Spirit in us. Protect us now and always with your divine peace. Amen. Like a panting deer in search of water, so my whole being seeks you, O God. I thirst for God, for the God of life. When will I be able to appear before God?... Why should I worry? Why am I going to worry? In God I will put my hope and I will still praise him. He is my Savior and my God! Psalm 42:1-2, 5\n \n
Lord our God, as the deer pants for fresh water, so our souls yearn for you, O God. Our souls thirst for you, for the living God. We come into your presence and pour out our hearts before you. We bring before you all that hurts us, all our sufferings and needs. We also bring you our hopes and many tests that you have given us so as not to ruin our lives, as they can be directed to great things. May the light of your Spirit shine in us today and always. Amen. Therefore, brothers, strive even more to make sure of the call of God, who was the one who chose you. If you do these things, you will never fall, and the gates of the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ will be thrown open for you. 2 Peter 1:10-11
Lord our God, we thank you that you have given us entrance into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. We thank you for having begun to give us a new vision, that many things are already being transformed, so that we can walk happily and confidently on our path, with hope of what is yet to be resolved. May all this live in our hearts and fill us with gratitude to you. We want to be brave and not lose sight of everything that still needs to change. Then we can participate as workers in your vineyard. May the light you have given us continue to shine in us, with greater intensity, as you have promised. Amen. In addition to all this, take the shield of faith, with which you can quench all the fiery arrows of the evil one. Ephesians 6:16
Lord our God, we long to enter your light and live in your strength, to do what pleases you and promote your kingdom on earth. Protect us from evil and do not allow us to be injured by the fiery arrows of the evil one. Whenever we don\'t know how to move on, make ways for us. We always know that you are our Father, and, because you are, we want to be brave and persevere until the end, so that our lives bear fruit for you, for the glory of your name. Amen. Do not conform to the current world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. In this way they will be able to verify what is the will of God, good, pleasant and perfect. Romans 12:2
Grant us your Spirit, Lord our God, that we may discern your good, pleasing and perfect will. Give us joy to fight by your side, so that the good, pleasant and perfect may be imparted to the world. Wherever we are and in whatever work we do, give us the fervor to serve you and be guided by you, so that your will may be done and your kingdom come, so that from now on we can find happiness, if only in hope. Amen. Lord, make me know your ways; show me your paths Guide me in your truth, teach me! You are my God and Savior, in you I put my hope all day! Psalm 25:4-5
Lord our God, be our Father and take care of your children on earth, where it is often extremely difficult and where everything seems to turn against us. Help us to remain faithful in our interior life, drawing from you all our strength, the eternal power of life, and from Jesus Christ, the Savior of the world. Because Jesus has promised to come to us, and you will send him in time of need. Let your strong hand be with those who often don\'t know where to turn. Show us paths we can follow, to the glory of your name for all eternity. Amen. Hear, Lord, my voice when I cry to you; pity me and answer me. My heart tells me: "Seek his face!" And I, Lord, seek your face. Do not hide from me. Psalm 27:7-9a
We thank you, beloved Father in heaven, for allowing the light of your face to shine in our hearts. We beseech you to consider our time; that, with your clear and penetrating gaze, allow everyone to feel that you observe them, more than they can understand. Let them realize that a strong God and mighty Father watches over them and cares for them. Protect us on our way, and allow your light to shine more and more intensely, so that in everything we do your name may be glorified. Amen. The Lord reigns, clothed in splendor; the Lord has clothed himself with greatness and has displayed his power. He has established the world firmly; he will never be removed. Psalm 93:1
Lord our God, you are king, founding a kingdom that reaches to the ends of the earth and its establishment will endure forever. We thank you for having refuge in your hands, so that no disease of the body or soul can do us permanent damage. We thank you for raising us again and again to true life, with the light and power to overcome what is earthly; true life with the flexibility to remain confident and secure no matter what happens; true life directed to the great destiny of the kingdom of God, promised in Jesus Christ. Amen. Remember your leaders, who communicated the word of God to you. Consider what was the result of your lifestyle, and imitate your faith... Do not be carried away by any kind of strange teachings. It is convenient that the heart be strengthened by grace, and not by ritual foods that are of no use to those who eat them. Hebrews 13:7, 9
Lord our God, dear Father in heaven, we thank you for all that you do in our lives, for reaching out to us on earth, through our Savior Jesus Christ. We entrust ourselves to you, knowing that everything depends on your sovereignty over our lives. Your reign is what allows us to move forward, with your strength and your light, always finding new joy, despite struggles and temptations. May your mighty hand be with those who invoke you, no matter how they do so. You know the hearts and you know who are sincere, and you will send your Savior to lead them out of evil and darkness. He stays with us now My sheep hear my voice; I know them and they follow me. I give them eternal life, and they will never perish, nor can anyone snatch them out of my hand. John 10:27-28
Dear Father in heaven, we thank you for changing our hearts, so that we understand that we are your children. Even in the midst of confusion and evil, fear and pain, you bring us happiness, we know that your right hand sustains us and that in the end you will deliver us from all evil. Allow your Spirit to work everywhere. Give us patience when time is needed in our own hearts and in the hearts of all peoples, who also belong to you. She continues to strengthen us, so that even the heaviest burden does not weigh us down, and we can rejoice in hope, as you right all evil, to the glory of your name. Amen. May all consider us servants of Christ, in charge of administering the mysteries of God. Now, those who receive an assignment are required to prove themselves trustworthy. 1 Corinthians 4:1-2
Dear Father in heaven, he opens our hearts, to appreciate and feel how our lives have been blessed. He opens our hearts to your blessings, so that we can look forward, with gratitude and joy, to what is to come. Grant us that we may be faithful to what we have received from you, and never again lose ourselves in fleeting moments. May we cling to all that is eternal that you have brought to our hearts, may your name be honored, and our lives be formed anew in Jesus Christ. Give us courage to rise above the ills of life and to look forward with joy and confident expectation to the future, when the powers of your kingdom will reveal themselves ever more clearly. Amen.

Life of Jesus The Miracles of Jesus Whatever you do, work willingly, as for the Lord and not as for anyone in this world, knowing that the Lord will reward you with the inheritance. You serve Christ the Lord. Colossians 3:23-24 Kindness and love will follow me all the days of my life; and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever. Seek peace with everyone, and holiness, without which no one will see the Lord. For just as in Adam all die, so in Christ all will live again. Corinthians 1 15:22 In fact, we know that if this tent we live in falls apart, we have a building from God, an eternal house in heaven, not built by human hands. 2 Corinthians 5:1 If we live, we live for the Lord; and, if we die, to the Lord we die. So whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord. Romans 14:8 Therefore, we too, who are surrounded by such a great multitude of witnesses, let us cast off the ballast that hinders us, especially the sin that besets us, and let us run with perseverance the race that lies ahead. Hebrews 12:1 He humiliated you and made you starve, but then he fed you with manna, food that neither you nor your ancestors had known, with which he taught you that man does not live by bread alone, but by everything that comes out of the mouth of the Lord . Deuteronomy 8:3 Be you holy, because I, the Lord, am holy, and I have distinguished you among the other nations, so that you may be mine. Leviticus 20:26 He also told them: “I give you from the earth all the plants that produce seed and all the trees that bear fruit with seed; all this will serve as food for them.” Genesis 1:29 My Lord and God, you are my rock, my defender, my deliverer! You are my strength and my shield, my powerful salvation, my high refuge. I trust you! Psalms 18:2
Noah\'s ark King Solomon Jonah and the big fish The creation Joseph the Slave The prodigal son David and Goliat The ten Commandments The three wise men The First Miracle of Jesus Samson the red sea Sodoma and Gomorra The Plagues of Egypt Jesus chooses his disciples The Best Children\'s Stories
Noah was a good and honest man. The other men on earth were bad and disobeyed God.
When the Lord saw that the evil of the human was very great and that the earth was full of violence, he repented of having created him and said to Noah:
-I have decided to end human beings, because because of them, evil reigns over the earth. Build a wooden ark because I am going to send a flood and everything that exists on earth will die. I will save you for being good along with your wife, your children and their wives. You must shelter in the ark a pair of each living species of birds, cattle and reptiles, male and female, who will survive with you. Also collect food and store it.
God also asked Noah to take seven of some animals and not just two individuals and told him that he would make it rain for forty days and forty nights.
Once his tasks were completed, Noah climbed into the ark, God closed the door and it began to rain. So much water fell that it covered the highest mountains. Thus all living creatures disappeared except Noah and those who were with him. The land was flooded for one hundred and fifty days.
Then God caused the waters to begin to subside. One day Noah, to see if the earth had dried up, opened a window of the ark and released a raven that was flying but he returned because he could not find a place to perch. Then he released a dove and the same thing happened. Seven days later Noah released the dove again, which returned with an olive leaf in its beak, the following week he knew that the land was dry because the dove did not return.
Finally God told Noah that he could leave the ark together with his family and the animals: “multiply and fill the earth”-God said.
Noah built an altar in gratitude to God for saving him and God made Noah a promise never again to send a flood to punish man.
As a sign that he would fulfill his promise, God put a rainbow in the sky.
Once upon a time there was a very wise king named Solomon. They all came to him for advice when they had problems they didn\'t know how to solve.
One day two women appeared before him, one spoke:
-Sir, this woman and I live in the same house, first I gave birth to a child and after three days she gave birth to another. During this time we have been alone, no one has visited us. One night this woman\'s son died because she lay on him, so while I slept she traded her dead son for my living son. When I got up in the morning to breastfeed, I thought my son had died, but I realized that the child lying next to me was not mine.
The other woman interrupted her:
-You lie, my son is the one who is alive and yours has died.
– You lie, your son is the one who is dead and mine is alive
The women were arguing thus when the king interrupted them, ordered a sword to be brought, and said:
– Split the living child in two and give one half to each woman.
Then the real mother of the child said through tears:
– Please don\'t kill him! Give the child to her.
While the other woman said:
-Neither me, nor you, break it.
In this way, the wise king knew who the real mother was and gave the child to the woman who preferred to give him up before they killed him. The king knew that only a mother is capable of giving up a child to protect him. Once upon a time there was a man named Jonah who was Jehovah\'s prophet. One day the Lord asked him to go to Nineveh, a great and powerful city that had been filled with evil, so that he could try to guide its inhabitants.
But Jonah didn\'t want to go, so he got into a boat going in the opposite direction from Nineveh. Jehovah did not like this, so he caused a severe storm and it seemed that the ship was going to sink.
To calm the storm and knowing that this was the consequence of his actions, Jonah asked the sailors to throw him into the sea. When his body fell, the waters calmed down and the storm stopped.
Jonah was then swallowed by a giant fish and remained alive in its belly for three days and three nights. While he was inside the fish he prayed to God for help, so the Lord made the fish vomit Jonah onto dry land.
After this adventure, Jonah finally made his way to Nineveh and complied with Jehovah\'s wishes. A long time ago, further back than all the time you can imagine, there was nothing. Only God existed.
God decided to create light, and on the first day of all days as we know them, God called the light day and the darkness night.
On the second day God created the sky and separated it from the waters.
On the third day God created the earth, and with it the flowers, trees and fruits.
On the fourth day God created the sun to rule the day, the moon to rule the night, and the stars. Together they were created to separate light from darkness, day from night, be signs of the seasons, days and years.
On the fifth day God created all living creatures from the sea and the air.
On the sixth day God created the land creatures, insects, reptiles and mammals. But that day God did something else: he created man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life. God also planted the Garden of Eden where all kinds of trees grew, and in the middle of the garden he planted the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
God took the man and put him in the garden to take care of it and allowed him to feed on all the trees except the tree of knowledge because if he did he would die. In addition, God gave him the task of naming all the created animals.
But the man was alone and God decided to give him a companion. For this he made the man fall into a deep sleep and while he slept he took out a rib and closed the wound. Hence he created woman.
On the seventh day when the heavens and the earth and everything in them were finished, God rested from his creative work Joseph was a good young man who loved God. Out of envy his brothers sold him into slavery and he was unjustly sent to prison. While in prison he met the king\'s butler and baker who had been imprisoned for offending Pharaoh. One night both men had a dream, the next morning Joseph offered to interpret them through God. The cupbearer spoke first: – I dreamed of a vine that had three branches, it flourished and the grapes on its clusters ripened. I took the grapes, squeezed them into Pharaoh\'s cup and gave it to him. Joseph interpreted: – The three branches are three days. Within three days Pharaoh will restore you to your position. Do not forget me, ask Pharaoh to get me out of this prison where I am unjustly. Then the baker told his dream: – I dreamed that I was carrying three baskets of bread on my head for Pharaoh, but the birds came and ate the bread. They walked on the backs of camels, dressed in rich crimson silk robes with turbans on their heads. Their names: Melchor, Gaspar and Baltasar. After several days of travel, the three wise men reached Jerusalem and there they were able to see the star closer and brighter than ever, their destination was near. They continued for a few more hours until they reached Bethlehem and, in the silent night, only the walking of their camels could be heard. Each kept the emotion of what awaited them in their hearts and none was able to utter a word. At last they reached a stable door and solemnly walked inside. There, cradled in the scented hay, receiving the warmth of an ox and a mule, and before the attentive gaze of his parents was El Niño who would be the savior of men. The events that Jesus experienced during his existence have been the basis for the foundation of Christianity and the establishment of a new chronology from his birth. For Christians, he is about the son of God born of the Virgin Mary. The stories of the Bible constitute the main source of information about his life and respond to the interpretation made by the Christian Church, a vision that establishes the beliefs about Jesus Christ and his role. Christianity focuses on living according to the values ​​that Christ taught and has marked Western culture throughout its existence. It is currently the most widespread religion in the world and is present on all continents.
BIRTH
Jesus was born in Bethlehem, where Joseph and Mary went to register him in the census. Then Herod the Great reigned, years before our era. FLIGHT TO EGYPT
The family traveled to Egypt to flee persecution from the King of the Jews, who ordered the slaughter of children under two years of age.
FIRST YEARS
To fulfill the requirements of Jewish law, Jesus had been circumcised and presented in the temple, a place to which he returned as a young man during the Passover festival.
HIDDEN LIFE
According to the writings of the Gospels, from the time Jesus Christ was 12 years old until he began his public life, 18 years passed in which what happened is unknown. From this stage he chooses the first disciples of his and begins the preaching of him.
BAPTISM
John the Baptist baptizes Jesus in the Jordan River, who then retreats to the edge of the desert for 40 days of fasting and meditation, during which he suffers the temptations of the devil. He then returns to Galilee, visits his home in Nazareth, and moves to Capernaum.
WHERE HE LIVED
After receiving baptism on the banks of the Jordan River, Jesus began preaching him in Galilee and spent his last moments in Jerusalem. By then, the Roman Empire had already subdued this region of the Middle East (64-63 BC). In 1947, the UN decided on a partition of Palestine into an Arab and a Jewish state. Israel occupied the West Bank, the Gaza Strip and the Golan Heights 20 years later. In 1994, Gaza and Jericho achieved autonomy.
PREACHING AND MIRACLES
Jesus Christ begins to preach in the company of his disciples and suffers the misunderstanding of the Pharisees and Sadducees. During this time he performs miracles that increase the number of his followers. In his last days, he travels to Jerusalem, where he expels the merchants and moneychangers from the temple, and the priests and scribes conspire against him.
CHRISTIANITY AND JUDAISM
Jesus Christ was born within the Jewish people and became the founder of a new religion, Christianity, based on his teachings, which are collected in the texts of the Gospels, the letters of Saint Paul and the book of the Acts of the Apostles (written from the 70s of the first century). For Christians, who admit only one God, Christ abolished the strict observance of Jewish law and renewed it. According to Judaism, the figure of Jesus receives a pejorative treatment and they do not recognize him as the one sent by God.
THE LAST SUPPER
After these events, Jesus celebrates the Easter dinner with his disciples, at which time the main sacrament of the Church, the Eucharist, is constituted. After this Last Supper he retired to the Garden of Gethsemane, where he was arrested. The supreme council of the Jews, the Sanhedrin, sentenced him to death for blasphemy, a sentence ratified by the Roman procurator Pontius Pilate.
DEATH AND RESURRECTION
Jesus Christ was taken to Golgotha, where he was crucified and placed in a tomb, although his body was not found. The apostles, after seeing and hearing him in and around Jerusalem, proclaimed his resurrection, a fact that Christians consider essential doctrine and signifies the hope of life after death.
